thread.title: Reports: Dan McCarney fired at North Texas
thread.title_full: Reports: Dan McCarney fired at North Texas

author: desmoinesregister.com
title: Reports: Dan McCarney fired at North Texas
text:
Buy Photo North Texas head coach Dan McCarney, right, was reportedly fired from his position following a 66-7 loss Saturday to FCS school Portland State. (Photo: Hawk Central file photo) Buy Photo
8 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Dan McCarney's days at North Texas are apparently done.
The former Iowa assistant and Iowa State coach was relieved of his duties following Saturday's 66-7 homecoming loss to Portland State, according to a report from Dallas Morning News beat writer Brett Vito.
Dan McCarney has been relieved of his duties as UNT's head coach, Rick VillarreL confirms after loss to Portland State
â€” Brett Vito (@brettvito) October 11, 2015 ESPN and other national outlets have confirmed the report.
The Mean Green were 3.5 underdogs to the FCS school. McCarney dropped to 22-32 in his tenure at North Texas following the Portland State defeat.
McCarney was an assistant under Iowa coach Hayden Fry alongside Kirk Ferentz and later coached Iowa State from 1995-2006.
McCarney returned to Iowa City to lead North Texas against the Hawkeyes, falling 62-16 on Sept. 26.
